content: for sewing and weaving weaving to weave the sections together start with the square and one of the ovals the top of the first oval should go under over with the bottom section going over under as shown to the right sew the two section of the oval together do not weave in ends and cut off as you can use the long ends to tack the sections together see optional note below turn counter-clockwise and weave in the second oval as seen to the left with the top of the oval being weaved from left under over under over with the bottom section being weaved opposite over under over under sew the ends of the second oval together optional continuing to use the long ends sew along the sections of the weave to tack them together to prevent shifting legal jargon copyright © 2008 kimberly langlois all rights reserved reproducing or transmitting this pattern by any means for any purpose other than for personal use constitutes a violation of copyright law this dishcloth may be made for personal use only should you wish to make the finished dishcloths for sale please contact for permission should you wish to use this pattern for a class or event please contact for permission
